  • Method Details

    • recheckAwaitQueue

      public void recheckAwaitQueue()
      That moment when you run out of ideas what to write in the documentation for your methods.

      Once upon a time there was a person named Zoe. They are nonbinary and they love coding.
      They got an assignment for school, they should program a simple game.
      Zoe thought it was a good idea to code a multi-player game for this assignment.
      Yea it might be a good idea if Zoe had some more free time.
      Now Zoe is sitting in front of their programming this game.
      Their head is exploding because the complexity of this project is way
      more than their small brain can handle. Zoe hates their former self because
      of this stupid decision to code a multi-player game.
      Zoe would rather like to lay in bed all day long and bruise their...
      ...
      their...
      ...
      t
      h
      e
      i
      r
      ... ....
      This might be too much personal stuff for an api documentation so ill end the story here.
      And they all lived happily ever after.

      Happily? Not sure about that part.


      If you are still interested in what the method does: It does some stuff with the awaiting input queue. It rechecks if the first element on the queue did already run out of time to response. If it did, it disconnects. If it isn't, it checks if the element is already done, if so it sends the next request to the client

      End the connection
      Parameters:
      logMessage - message in the log
      logType - type of log message
      lastOutput - message sent to the client (reason for disconnect)
